Kubo.Action: Tidies up his living space carefully, smoothing out and stacking repeatedly folded papers.
Prepares rice and tea for two, showing thoughtfulness and consideration.
Gently pushes his mother’s hair out of her face and gives a small smile as an unspoken good morning.
Helps his feeble mother up to the mat, demonstrating care and attentiveness.
Blows on his mother’s rice to cool it before serving.
Uses chopsticks gently to return spilled grains of rice back into his mother’s mouth.
Tidies up his living space meticulously by smoothing and stacking wrinkled papers.
Starts a fire using flint confidently in pre-dawn conditions.
Prepares food and tea thoughtfully and gracefully for two.
Shows gentle care in tending to his mother, helping her sit and blowing on her rice to cool it.
Uses chopsticks carefully to put rice back into his mother's mouth when she drops some.
Uses his chopsticks to gently put grains of rice back into his mother's mouth.
Leans on his mother's shoulder as the sun rises, showing closeness and comfort.
Gently pushes a strand of hair back in front of his mother’s face.
Looks at mother’s staring empty eyes and rests his hand on her shoulder before leaving.
Folds origami figures skillfully and quickly with nimble hands, demonstrating expert work.
Responds instantly to the sound of a bell by hastily gathering his belongings and preparing to leave.
Shows gentle and caring behavior toward his mother by pushing a hair back into place and resting his hand on her shoulder.
Plays with his origami samurai while walking down the mountain path, which may suggest distraction but also comfort and skillful multitasking.
Sits down next to the beggar woman Kameyo, engages her with friendly conversation and shares a laugh.
Scrambles down rocky path with practiced ease, plays with origami samurai while walking.
Sits next to Kameyo and engages her with light-hearted conversation, showing social ease and confidence.
Responds confidently and with humor to Kameyo’s question about working in a fire-breathing chicken.
Rolls his eyes playfully yet clearly enjoys the joke about the fire-breathing chicken, laughs and agrees to add comedy to his act.
Smiles and confidently performs for the crowd, engaging them sincerely with his story and music.
Engages audience with a dramatic and interactive storytelling, encouraging children to participate.
Silences the cheering crowd to maintain order and focus.
Encourages Kameyo to participate by nodding at her when she wants to name the armor piece.
Performs an intense and entertaining story display for the crowd, engaging and delighting audience including children and elders.
Successfully assembles and commands an ornate breastplate, sword, and helmet through his shamisen strings, demonstrating skilled control over his craft.
Engages the crowd with a dynamic, imaginative performance, creating and controlling complex origami creatures in a battle reenactment.
Smiles brightly after ending performance abruptly, invites crowd to come back tomorrow.
Hurries to leave after stopping the story with no ending, despite crowd’s disappointment.
Sits gently next to his mother and smiles, sharing a quiet moment watching the sunset.
Begins playing a more ominous tune, skillfully summons and animates paper figures including a dark silhouette of the Moon King, demonstrating his storytelling and magical abilities.
Displays gravitas and confidence in his performance, successfully captivating and entertaining the crowd.
Stops his performance abruptly when the bell rings, folding the origami figures instantly and gathering his belongings quickly despite the crowd’s disappointment.
Leaves the audience without providing a conclusion to the story, causing disappointment and murmurs among them.
Smiles gently at his mother and sits next to her, taking her hand when she wakes.
Softly offers to feed his mother when she appears hungry.
Listens intently and shows excitement and curiosity during his mother's storytelling.
Tries to play down his mother's memory lapses, showing understanding and patience.
Arrives at the cave breathlessly but smiles gently and calmly sits next to his mother, showing emotional steadiness and awareness.
Takes his mother by the hand and tenderly interacts with her, showing considerate responsiveness.
Engages attentively with his mother’s storytelling and asks specific, relevant questions about Hanzo and the castle, demonstrating curiosity and understanding.
When his mother struggles to recall the story, Kubo tries to downplay the situation gently, indicating emotional intelligence and social skill.
Asks sincerely about his father’s true nature beyond being a warrior.
Smiles and giggles with his mother when she playfully grabs his cheek.
Timidly promises his mother to stay safe and hidden, showing respect and care.
Asks thoughtful questions about his father and family, showing curiosity and desire to understand.
Nods timidly when promised to stay hidden, indicating some hesitation and lack of confidence in facing the danger.
Keeps his mother’s safety in mind by agreeing to never stay out after dark and carries father’s robe for protection.
Shares a tender moment laughing and being playful with his mother through the monkey voice.
Gently lays his mother down on her mat and watches over her as she falls asleep.
Responds immediately to his mother’s nightmare by waking her up out of concern.
Patiently answers his mother and shows concern, though he looks sad and does not speak further.
Responds with an awkward grin and amiability to Kameyo's friendly invitation despite feeling sleepy.
Comforts his mother by responding calmly to her calling and presence even when she is confused and asleep.
Looks at the mess of strewn paper thoughtfully, showing awareness of the situation and its origin.
Rubs his injured eye and yawns, then sleeps through the bustling festival and does not actively participate or display alertness.
Responds awkwardly but politely to Kameyo’s attention, showing social awareness but some social discomfort.
Shows genuine interest and curiosity about speaking to loved ones who have passed, asks sincere questions.
Smiles excitedly, waves kindly at the old woman before running off to engage in a communal activity.
Realizes the possibility of making a lamp using his paper folding skills after the hint from Kameyo.
Looks around at altars and lamps, showing some initial uncertainty about what is needed.
Responds enthusiastically to Kameyo's encouragement and immediately runs off to take action without hesitation.
Creates a simple yet beautiful lamp for the altar, follows family ritual, and prays quietly and sincerely for his deceased father.
Jokes lightly while addressing his father, trying to bring some levity to a serious moment.
Expresses worry and concern for his mother’s wellbeing honestly and vulnerably.
Fashions a rough altar and creates a simple yet beautiful lamp from an ivory sheet of paper.
Attempts to pray quietly but awkwardly under his breath, struggling to find the right words and expressing dislike of what he just said.
Directly addresses his father with honesty and vulnerability about his concerns, despite awkwardness.
Stares defiantly at his unlit lamp, then angrily crumples and tosses it, saying 'Fine! I don’t need you anyway!'
After calming down, he picks up the broken lamp and softly apologizes, 'I... I’m sorry.'
Stares defiantly at the unlit lamp, crumples and angrily tosses it to the ground, verbally lashes out.
After cooling down, shows self-awareness and humility by apologizing and carefully smoothing out the broken lamp to repair it.
Responds with caution and wariness to the Sisters, stepping back when sensing danger
Looks around quickly and senses the danger in the eerie atmosphere.
Takes a step backwards cautiously upon seeing the Sisters, showing awareness and wariness.
Questions the Sisters about who they are and how they know his name, indicating alertness and critical thinking.
Does not flee immediately despite sensing danger, maintaining his composure.
Shouts and warns villagers loudly about the approaching danger despite the chaos.
Runs away quickly from the threatening sisters and the demonic smoke, showing instinctive self-preservation.
Shouts warnings loudly to others about the approaching danger in an effort to protect the villagers.
Fails to effectively alert or save the villagers as his warnings are drowned out by festival noise and chaos ensues, leading to widespread destruction.
Attempts to escape by running toward his cave but stumbles and is surrounded by demons, indicating his vulnerability in the situation.
Clutches at his mother tightly as he is lifted away, accidentally tearing out a few strands of her hair.
Clutches at his mother and accidentally tears out a few strands of her hair as he rises into the sky with magical wings.
Remembers to seek the armor as instructed by his mother, showing some understanding of his dire situation.
Shuffles backward through snow, dazed and disoriented upon learning of the village destruction and threat to his safety.
Climbs onto Monkey's back and accepts her help without resistance despite being shocked and vulnerable.
Nods to indicate he has questions and tries to speak, showing openness to communication.
Watches Monkey with a knitted brow and a scowl, showing suspicion and distrust initially.
Stares silently at the ground, keeping his thoughts and emotions buried instead of sharing.
Nods in response to Monkey's observation and tries to ask questions, showing engagement and willingness to learn.
Looks less than thrilled and scowls suspiciously when confronted with confusing or surprising information.
Keeps thoughts and emotions to himself, indicating some level of emotional control and reflection.
Despite reluctance, eventually accepts the stew to maintain strength and follow Monkey's advice.
Playfully slurps soup loudly to provoke Monkey after accepting it.
Reluctantly accepts Monkey’s insistence and drinks the stew despite his initial refusal, showing he can recognize necessity and comply when needed.
Sarcastically slurps the soup loudly after being told to drink seriously, showing playful defiance rather than focused behavior.
Responds timidly to Monkey’s warning about danger and asks what to do next, demonstrating awareness of his situation and seeking guidance.
Hands Monkey the strand of his mother's hair after instinctively jerking away, showing trust despite initial hesitation.
Asks Monkey questions respectfully and accepts uncertainty about finding the armor, showing openness and vulnerability.
Lies down quietly and says good night to Monkey, expressing gentle friendliness.
Hands Monkey the strand of his mother's hair despite instinctively jerking away, showing trust and calmness.
Asks pertinent questions about the armor and situation, demonstrating curiosity and engagement.
Realizes the severity of their situation, with uncertainty showing on his face, revealing vulnerability and limited understanding.
Accepts Monkey's command to sleep quietly despite not having answers, showing patience and self-control.
Reaches out to touch Little Hanzo origami figure gently, showing curiosity and openness.
Persists in moving Little Hanzo to point a different direction despite the figure’s clear preference, showing playful engagement.
Questions Little Hanzo's behavior sincerely, indicating interest and friendly interaction.
Steps over to inspect the origami figure and tries to interact with it by reaching out to touch it.
Tries to change the origami Little Hanzo's direction by moving the bag, testing how it reacts.
Initially puzzled by the origami's behavior, asking what it means.
Laughs joyously and giggles while playing shamisen, spreading happiness in the moment.
Creates beautiful paper birds that fly and frolic, sharing his wonder and joy openly.
Takes time to enjoy a moment despite pressing challenges, showing sincere and good-natured behavior.
Creates and commands a flock of paper birds that dance beautifully in the sky, showing skilled control of his shamisen and magic.
Lags behind the group as he looks up at the bird, showing curiosity but momentary distraction from the group’s objective.

Playfully commands paper birds to nip Monkey on the backside, teasing her in a mischievous but lighthearted way.

Denies responsibility for the paper mosquitos attacking Monkey, though admits he 'felt it' happening.
Responds to Monkey’s skepticism with honesty about his partial involvement and confusion.
Lags behind and imagines himself as the valiant hero, calls Monkey 'the mean monkey' playfully.
Does not argue or resist when Monkey turns her back and continues walking after telling him about the dangers.
Stops Monkey from attacking Beetle, explaining Beetle meant no harm and only wanted Hanzo.

Turns to Beetle deliberately before revealing his lineage, indicating purposeful and confident behavior.

Responds patiently to skepticism about Beetle without dismissiveness or sarcasm.
Uses his shamisen to create a paper bird that draws attention and mediates between arguing companions.
Recognizes the potential usefulness of Beetle despite Monkey’s distrust, showing quick assessment and openness.

Points out the weakness in the Odokuro’s defenses to his companions during battle, helping coordinate their actions.

Plays his shamisen skillfully to orchestrate an origami bird assault to protect his friends.

Smiles of satisfaction but immediately realizes he is in danger as the monster crumbles beneath him, indicating awareness and caution.
No evident failure or embarrassment; although he falls from a height, he responds effectively to the situation.
Runs excitedly to share the success of getting the sword with Beetle.

Responds to praise with a grin and playful mock shove.

Warns Beetle to wait before jumping into the ocean, showing care and concern.

Relays a cautionary tale about the Garden of Eyes to warn others of potential danger.

Swims to retrieve and don the golden breastplate armor to protect himself and continue his quest.
Remains unconscious and vulnerable underwater, implicitly trusting Beetle to rescue him.

Unconscious, no direct action in this excerpt.
Is unconscious and needs to be rescued; unable to act during crisis.

Looks directly at Monkey and expresses having seen his mother.
Asks Monkey politely to tell them her story so they can sleep, showing respect and patience.

Opens his eye and looks directly at Monkey, demonstrating focus and intentional communication despite weakness.
Asks Monkey politely to tell her story, showing emotional intelligence and social skill in easing tension and fostering cooperation.
Listens quietly and respectfully as Monkey tells a serious and emotional story about his father and his past.
Gently nudges Beetle to hush him when he interrupts the story, showing consideration and respect for Monkey.
Responds to the shocking revelation with a brief 'Oh. Right.' without expressing curiosity or deeper emotional engagement.

Looks at shredded paper and asks why Grandfather hates him, expressing vulnerability.

Lies peacefully sleeping, allowing others to care for one another around him.

Swiftly prepares by packing Little Hanzo and signals the others to follow.

Identifies an unfamiliar sound as a song rather than a physical phenomenon like snow.

Shows understanding and appreciation of the beautiful and meaningful nature of the song of the glowing birds.

Excitedly pushes through the screens upon seeing the golden helmet illustration, showing focus and confidence.
Slashes the Sister's mask, breaking it and freeing Monkey and Beetle from smoke demons' power.
Cries out for Monkey, showing emotional connection and concern.

Looks up to Beetle and addresses him as 'Father', showing trust and affection.
Slashes at the Sister with his bachi pick, cracking her mask and breaking the pipe, thereby destroying the source of the smoke demons' power.
Despite being unconscious and disoriented, comforts Monkey and shows emotional strength by soothing her.
Is tossed across the courtyard and knocked unconscious, failing to defend himself effectively against the Sister's assault.
Races to protect Monkey by playing shamisen violently to create a powerful shockwave that defeats the Sister.
Weeps silently after the battle, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Races to grab the shamisen and plays it violently despite the strings snapping, unleashing a powerful shockwave of light that overcomes the Sister's attack.
Is left on hands and knees trying to recover after the attack, with broken items around him and only one string left on the shamisen.
Shows care and respect by kneeling to take the broken bowstring and wrapping it with his mother’s bracelet around his wrist.
Acknowledges the damaged but determined Hanzo Origami, recognizing its effort and meaning.
Pauses thoughtfully over Beetle’s broken bow before taking the string, indicating respect for his friend.
Plays one last note with emotion, signaling a sincere farewell to his past and friends.
Warns survivors to leave the dangerous place without pressing them for questions, showing concern for their safety.
Faces the Grandfather, shouts his name to confront him, demonstrating sincerity and courage.
Throws a rock at Grandfather in defiance, expressing anger toward a hostile figure but not aggression toward others.
Determinedly strikes the broken tower until it collapses to retrieve the helmet.
Warns survivors to leave quickly without hesitation.
Puts on the helmet, grips the sword confidently, and calls out to confront his Grandfather.

Admits to fault for starting conflict by not listening to parents.
Accuses Grandfather of being old, mean, and cruel.
Calmly engages with Grandfather despite hostility.
Throws a rock at Grandfather showing initiative and courage.
Calmly converses with Grandfather, acknowledging fault and understanding the situation.
Takes a breath and smiles affably despite tension, showing emotional control.
Firmly challenges Grandfather’s narrative, showing critical thinking.
Expresses grief and accuses Grandfather of killing his family, which indicates strong emotion but might reduce composure.
Fixes his grandfather with a look filled with fire and shouts 'I kill you!' ready to battle the monster who ruined his life.
Yells and runs at the monstrous beast with sword held high, fighting to protect despite overwhelming odds.
Fixes his grandfather with a look filled with fire and confidently declares he will kill him.
Raises his sword and charges at the towering Moon Beast despite its size and power.
Successfully connects sword strikes on the Moon Beast, including a deep slice to its eye, gaining advantage in the fight.
Ducks, somersaults, and weaves effectively to evade the monster’s attacks.
Continuing to fight despite running out of breath and seeming to be in a losing battle.
Withdraws his hand from the sword and instead re-strings his shamisen using his mother’s hair and Beetle’s bow string.
Refuses to leave his home despite danger, showing defiance and commitment.
Uses a hair from his own head to complete the shamisen string, demonstrating self-sacrifice.
Speaks about seeing beauty even with just one eye, expressing hope and appreciation for others' perspectives.
Explains that love is seen through memories and connection to others' souls.
Calls attention to the villagers' return and their shared support, highlighting community and trust.
Defiantly stands up to the Moon Beast instead of fleeing.
Uses his own hair to complete the shamisen string, showing resourcefulness.
Plucks a powerful string on the shamisen to surprise and momentarily stop the Moon Beast.
Speaks confidently about the power of memories and love, showing mental and emotional strength.
Holds the crowd’s attention and gains support from surviving villagers with his performance and words.
Gestures to his army of villagers and spirits, explaining their strength comes from memories of loved ones lost.

Strums all three strings at once to unleash a powerful attack that blinds the opponent and culminates in a significant victory.

Responds to the old man's doubt with reassurance: 'Of course...' when asked if he will tell the stories.
Responds confidently with 'Of course...' when encouraged to tell stories to the old man.
Quietly assembles an altar for his parents and speaks sincerely to them, expressing gratitude and a desire for unity.
Admits uncertainty and shows vulnerability by saying he doesn’t know all the rules but expresses a heartfelt wish to have his parents' presence.
